channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Therapy Sessions Exposed by Mental Health Care Firm’s Unsecured Database
item.description: Video and audio of therapy sessions, transcripts, and other patient records were accidentally exposed in a publicly accessible database operated by th...

item.title: Google faces provisional antitrust charges in UK for ‘self-preferencing’ its ad exchange
item.description: More antitrust woes for Google. The U.K’.s competition watchdog said on Friday that it suspects the company of adtech antitrust abuses. The tech giant...

item.title: Could AI and Deepfakes Sway the US Election?
item.description: This week on Politics Lab, we’re talking about AI’s potential impact on the election—and why it’s so hard to regulate nationwide.

item.title: Karo is a to-do app that lets you assign tasks to your friends and family

item.title: Elon Musk Has Backed Himself Into a Corner in Brazil
item.description: After a public standoff with a judge over X and Starlink’s operations in the country, Elon Musk is showing signs of wavering.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X could still face sanctions for training Grok on Europeans’ data

item.title: All the Top New Gadgets at IFA 2024

item.title: Telegram quietly enables users to report private chats to moderators after founder’s arrest
item.description: Telegram has quietly updated its policy to allow users to report private chats to its moderators following the arrest of founder Pavel Durov in France...

item.title: Why Super Typhoons Like Yagi Are More Common Than You’d Think

item.title: ‘Stop harassing Starlink,’ SpaceX president tells Brazilian judge
